thread.title: Why Did New England Gas Prices Jump Nearly 90%? Blame Severe Storm

author: Stephanie Yang
title: Why Did New England Gas Prices Jump Nearly 90%? Blame Severe Storm
text:
A major winter storm pounding the East Coast is driving up heating demand and energy prices, as the eastern half of the U.S. grapples with a stretch of extreme cold not seen in years.
The National Weather Service issued a warning for “bitterly cold temperatures and dangerous wind chills” stretching from the Southeast to New England through the rest of the week.
